snippet: The recommendations of New York City’s Rent Guidelines Board include the possibility of a freeze for one-year leases. The board will take a final vote in June.
abstract: New York City’s Rent Guidelines Board votes to recommend unusually low range of possible rent increases for rent-stabilized apartments, even raising possibility of rent freeze for one-year leases; vote, favoring increases from zero percent to 3 percent for one-year lease renewals and from half a percent to 4.5 percent for two-year leases starting in October, provides glimpse of how the board will operate under Mayor Bill de Blasio.
lead_paragraph: The recommendations of New York City’s Rent Guidelines Board include the possibility of a freeze for one-year leases. The board will take a final vote in June.

headline.main: Rent Board Backs Raises Much Smaller Than Usual
headline.print_headline: Rent Board Backs Raises Much Smaller Than Usual
